lines: You are about to leave ${childName} in the tender loving care of your mother. You give her a brief list of rules regarding sleep ("Do not let ${childName} stay up too late."); eating ("Restrict the junkfood. Sugar makes ${childName} hyper."); and playthings
("Please do not buy ${childName} any fancy toys. Every time we pass a toy store, ${childName} wants something.")

When you return, you find out that ${childName} was allowed to watch the Johnny Carson show every night ("Now, Now. There was no school, so what's the harm.") ${childName} is bouncing off the walls and running in circles on the floor -- there is a
huge (empty) box of chocolates on the table. ("Oh, come on. Just a taste, Sweetheart.")
On the way out, Mom yells, "${childName}, don't forget the shopping bag!" (which happens to be full of toys). ("They're all EDUCATIONAL toys, Dear.")
#GET FURIOUS AND REALLY LET HER HAVE IT
#RESOLVE THAT THERE IS NOTHING YOU CAN DO ABOUT IT

This causes a big fight. The two of you start to yell and scream at one another. You accuse her of spoiling the child. She accuses you of not leting her love her grandchild. ${childName} begins to cry. You blame it on one another.
Mom gives ${childName} a big piece of chocolate. "It will calm the child."
On the way home, ${childName} asks why you are so mean to
Mom gets the message, but it is hard for her to resist. She apologizes.

There is plenty you can do about it. You just don't want to rock the boat. Sometimes grandparents feel a bit guilty about being strict with their own children. When the grandchildren start to appear, they have a chance to absolve

As wonderful a treat as this is for the child, it sometimes sets up an imbalance of power between parents and grandparents. The grandparents become "the good guys," and the parents become "the bad guys."
You can easily lose control of your child this way, and that is a condition you would like to avoid.
